intro: Seseli besserianum, commonly known as the Balkan seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some areas.
